metadata.title: CVE-2024-41810 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Twisted is an event-based framework for internet applications, supportingPython 3.6+. The `twisted.web.util.redirectTo` function contains an HTMLinjection vulnerability. If application code allows an attacker to controlthe redirect URL this vulnerability may result in Reflected Cross-SiteScripting (XSS) in the redirect response HTML body. This vulnerability isfixed in 24.7.0rc1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-41810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-twisted - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-bin - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-core - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-mail - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-names - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-news - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-runner - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-web - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-words - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python3-twisted - 16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
python-twisted-conch - 1:16.0.0-1ubuntu0.4+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
